types.Application: fields: router Router, middleware Array<Function>, settings Object
types.Route: fields: path String, method String, handlers Array<Function>
types.Request: fields: req IncomingMessage, app Application, body Any, query Object, params Object, cookies Object, originalUrl String
types.Response: fields: res ServerResponse, app Application, statusCode Number, locals Object
types.Layer: fields: fn Function, path String, regexp RegExp, keys Array<Object>
types.TrieNode: fields: children Map, handlers Map, paramName String, paramChild TrieNode, isLeaf Boolean
types.Template: fields: source String, compiledFn Function, blocks Map<String, String>
types.HttpError: fields: message String, status Number, expose Boolean, originalError Error
types.WebSocketConnection: fields: socket Any, request Request, handlers Object
types.SessionStore: fields: get Function, set Function, destroy Function
types.Plugin: fields: name String, version String, install Function

methods.router.match(method, path) returns Objec: Finds a matching route for method/path
methods.Layer.match(path) returns boolean: Test if path matches layer pattern
methods.Router.register(method, path, handlers): Register a route with the router
methods.router.register(method, path, ...handler: Registers a route with the router
methods.TrieNode.insert(segments, index, method,: Inserts a path pattern into the trie
methods.TrieNode.search(segments, index, params): Searches for a matching route in the trie
methods.res.status(code) returns: Sets HTTP status code, returns Response for chaining
methods.res.json(data) returns: Sends JSON response, sets appropriate headers
methods.res.send(body) returns: Sends response with inferred content type
methods.res.redirect([status,] url) returns: Redirects request to URL with status code
methods.res.cookie(name, value [, options]) retu: Sets a cookie with options, returns Response
methods.res.clearCookie(name [, options]) return: Clears a cookie by setting expired value, returns Response
methods.json(options) returns: Middleware factory returning JSON body parser middleware
methods.Template.compile(source) returns compile: Compiles template source string into render function
methods.Template.renderFile(path, context) retur: Reads, compiles, and renders template file with context
methods.app.engine(ext, engineFunction) returns: Registers template engine for file extension
methods.res.render(templateName, context) return: Renders template with context and sends HTML response
methods.router.dispatch(req, res, next) returns: Dispatch request to matching route or pass to error handlers
methods.next(err) returns void: Advance to next middleware or error handler
methods.wrapMiddleware(fn) returns Function: Wraps middleware to catch async errors
methods.jsonBodyParser(options) returns Function: Creates JSON body parser middleware with size limits
methods.safeJsonParse(str, maxLength) returns An: Safely parses JSON with error handling
methods.static(root, options) returns Function: Middleware factory for static file serving

constants.HTTP_METHODS: Array of standard HTTP methods: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, HEAD, OPTIONS

terms.middleware: Function with signature (req, res, next) that processes requests in pipeline
terms.router trie: Prefix tree data structure for efficient route matching
terms.factory pipeline: Analogy for request processing through sequential middleware stations
terms.chain of responsibility: Design pattern where each handler decides to process or pass to next handler
terms.parameter extraction: Process of extracting named values from URL path segments
terms.template engine: Component that compiles templates and renders them with data context
terms.enhanced request/response: Wrapper objects around native HTTP objects with added properties and methods
terms.prefix tree: Tree data structure where nodes represent prefixes of keys (URL segments)
terms.body parsing: Process of interpreting request body bytes into structured data (JSON, urlencoded, etc.)
terms.cookie parsing: Extracting key-value pairs from the Cookie request header
terms.query parameters: Key-value pairs extracted from the URL query string (after ?)
terms.variable interpolation: Process of replacing template placeholders with provided values
terms.HTML escaping: Encoding special characters to prevent XSS attacks
terms.template inheritance: Mechanism allowing child templates to extend base layout templates
terms.AST (Abstract Syntax Tree): Tree representation of template structure used during compilation
terms.code generation: Process of converting AST to executable JavaScript function
terms.template caching: Storing compiled template functions to avoid recompilation
terms.error handling mode: Pipeline state where only error-handling middleware (4-arity functions) execute
terms.phase tracking: Debugging technique to monitor request progression through pipeline states
terms.error-handling middleware: Middleware with 4 parameters (err, req, res, next) that handles errors
terms.error mode: Pipeline state where only error-handling middleware executes
terms.expose flag: Boolean indicating whether error details should be sent to client
terms.LRU cache: Least Recently Used cache eviction strategy
terms.stream backpressure: Mechanism to prevent overwhelming streams with data
terms.cookie security flags: Attributes like httpOnly, secure, sameSite that enhance cookie security
terms.template cache poisoning: When cached templates become stale or contain errors
terms.unhandled promise rejection: Promise error without .catch() handler that can crash Node.js process
terms.WebSocket upgrade: HTTP protocol upgrade mechanism to switch to WebSocket protocol
terms.static file serving: Serving files directly from filesystem without dynamic processing
terms.session management: Maintaining user-specific state across multiple HTTP requests
terms.CSRF protection: Security measure to prevent cross-site request forgery attacks
terms.response compression: Compressing HTTP response bodies to reduce bandwidth
terms.plugin ecosystem: System for third-party extensions to add functionality
terms.health checks: Endpoints that report application status for monitoring
terms.sendfile system call: Kernel optimization for efficient file-to-network transfers
terms.MIME type detection: Identifying content type based on file extension or content
terms.range requests: HTTP feature for requesting specific byte ranges of a resource
terms.session store: Backend storage for session data (memory, Redis, database)
terms.ETag: HTTP header for cache validation using content hash
terms.content-encoding: HTTP header indicating compression algorithm used
